thinkpol.api package¶

Submodules¶

thinkpol.api.api module¶

class thinkpol.api.api.API(host, port, database)¶

Bases: object

An object that holds the relevant data for taking data from a database and displaying it through an API.

Parameters

  • host (str) – the API connection’s host

  • port (int) – the API connection’s port

  • database (DataBase) – the database

thinkpol.api.api.handle_result(user_id, snapshot_id, result_name)¶

Handles a request to see data about a specific field in a snapshot.

Parameters

  • user_id (int) – the desired user’s id

  • snapshot_id (int) – the desired snapshot’s id (datetime in seconds)

  • result_name (str) – the field of the desired result

Returns

data about the desired snapshot

Return type

json

thinkpol.api.api.handle_result_data(user_id, snapshot_id, result_name)¶

Handles a request to see binary data associated with a specific field in a snapshot.

Parameters

  • user_id (int) – the desired user’s id

  • snapshot_id (int) – the desired snapshot’s id (datetime in seconds)

  • result_name (str) – the field of the desired result

Returns

data about the desired snapshot

Return type

json

thinkpol.api.api.handle_snapshot(user_id, snapshot_id)¶

Handles a request to see data about a specific user’s snapshot. :param user_id: the desired user’s id :type user_id: int :param snapshot_id: the desired snapshot’s id (datetime in seconds) :type snapshot_id: int :returns: data about the desired snapshot :rtype: json

thinkpol.api.api.handle_snapshots(user_id)¶

Handles a request to see data about a specific user’s snapshots.

Parameters

user_id (int) – the desired user’s id

Returns

data about the desired user’s snapshots

Return type

json

thinkpol.api.api.handle_user(user_id)¶

Handles a request to see data about a specific user.

Parameters

user_id (int) – the desired user’s id

Returns

data about the desired user

Return type

json

thinkpol.api.api.handle_users()¶

Handles a request to see data about all users.

Returns

data about all users

Return type

json

Module contents¶

Creates an API server that presents data as pulled from a database. :param db_options: a dictionary containing options for database objects from which we can pull data :type db_options: dict

thinkpol.api.parse_url(url)¶

Receives a url that specifies which database we should connect to, connects to it and returns a database object that the server can use.

Parameters

url (str) – the database format url (formatted database_type://host:port)

Returns

a corresponding database object

Return type

DataBase

Raises

ValueError

thinkpol.api.run_api_server(host, port, database_url)¶

Runs an API server that connects to a specified database and presents data from there.

Parameters

  • host (str) – the api connection’s host

  • port (int) – the api connection’s port

  • database_url (str) – a formatted url specifying the database we connect to

Thinkpol
